sub_topic: Identifying the Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph:
```
A -- B -- C 
|    |    | 
D -- E -- F 
```

Does this graph have an Eulerian circuit? If so, what is the Eulerian circuit? Does it have a Hamiltonian circuit? If so, what is the Hamiltonian circuit?
message_2:
An Eulerian circuit is a closed walk that visits every edge exactly once. A graph has an Eulerian circuit if and only if all vertices have even degrees. In this graph, all vertices have degree 4, which is even. Therefore, this graph has an Eulerian circuit. One possible Eulerian circuit is:

A - B - C - F - E - D - A - E - B - F - C - E

A Hamiltonian circuit is a closed walk that visits every vertex exactly once. This graph does have a Hamiltonian circuit. One possible Hamiltonian circuit is:

A - B - C - F - E - D - A
